  • Method Details

    • broadcast

      public NSPServer broadcast​(byte[] sendBytes)
      Broadcasts a ByteArray to every Client that is currently connected.
      Parameters:
      sendBytes - ByteArray To Send

    • broadcast

      public NSPServer broadcast​(byte[] sendBytes, List<Client> group)
      Broadcasts a ByteArray to a specified List of Clients.
      Parameters:
      sendBytes - ByteArray To Send

    • allowIncoming

      public NSPServer allowIncoming()
      Enables Incoming Connections by Activating the ConnectionActivator Thread.
      See Also:
      connectManagerThread

    • denyIncoming

      public NSPServer denyIncoming()
      Disables Incoming Connections by Deactivating the ConnectionActivator Thread.
      See Also:
      connectManagerThread

    • totalConnected

      public int totalConnected()
      Returns:
      Total Amount of Connected Clients

    • addListener

      public NSPServer addListener​(ServerListener listener)
      Adds a ServerListener to the list, which sends Events during a client connection, disconnection, and when there is a new message. This is fully asynchronous and doesn't require any blocking methods.
      Parameters:
      listener - ServerListener Object

    • getOptions

      public ServerOption getOptions()
      Returns:
      Server Options

    • bind

      public NSPServer bind() throws IOException
      Activates the server connection by creating the new ServerSocket instance, and starting the SocketAcceptor and global ConnectionManager Threads.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there are any errors related to starting the Server.

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Disconnects all the Clients from the Server, and then closes the ServerSocket.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there are any errors while closing the Server.

    • getConnectedList

      public static ArrayList<String> getConnectedList()
      This function is designed to be used to return the list of Preferred Identifiers for each Client connected, rather than always giving away the IP address like the getClients function would. This is intended for the handshaking process or when the Client requests the list of all currently connected clients. Each client on the returned list will either have its IP address, or its custom ID depending on which one it chose.
      Returns:
      Safe List of Connected Clients
      See Also:
      getIPClients(String, boolean)

    • getConnectedPacket

      protected static Packet getConnectedPacket()
      Returns:
      A network send-able Packet containing the Connection Time and Preferred ID of each Client.

    • getClientStatic

      public static ArrayList<Client> getClientStatic​(String identifier, boolean port)
      Looks up the specified Client Identifier with Optional Port and returns a List of all Client instances containing the Identifier.
      Parameters:
      identifier - Client Identifier
      port - If port should be used when looking up IP
      Returns:
      List of Client Objects containing Identifier

    • getClients

      public ArrayList<Client> getClients​(String identifier, boolean port)
      Looks up the specified Client Identifier with Optional Port and returns a List of all Client instances containing the Identifier.
      Parameters:
      identifier - Client Identifier
      port - If port should be used when looking up IP
      Returns:
      List of Client Objects containing Identifier

    • getClientList

      public Queue<Client> getClientList()
      Returns:
      Client List

    • getIPClients

      public ArrayList<Client> getIPClients​(String ipAddress, boolean port)
      Looks up the specified Client IP Address with Optional Port and returns a List of all Client instances containing the IP Address.
      Parameters:
      ipAddress - Client IP Address
      port - If port should be used
      Returns:
      List of Client Objects containing IP Address

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns:
      Returns true if Thread and Server are running, false otherwise.
